purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses and hostname, then sends this data to external domains for tracking purposes.
flows: MAC addresses -> Buffer -> base64 encoding -> network transmission
anomalies: Use of hardcoded C2 domains that appear to be part of a tracking infrastructure
Sending system information to external domains without user consent
Usage of 'rejectUnauthorized: false' which disables SSL certificate verification
Insecure HTTP requests to external domains
analysis: The code collects sensitive system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends it via unencrypted HTTP requests to known tracking domains. This behavior is highly indicative of telemetry or tracking functionality commonly found in malware or spyware.
conclusion: This code exhibits clear malicious behavior by collecting system identifiers and transmitting them to remote servers without explicit user consent.
